dialogues.CAT:
[1]Working on it Mama. 
[2]I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero. 
[3]Are we going to see Uncle Emilio? 2. 
[4]I'm packed Mama. 
[5]I don't understand papa. 
[6]I love you too Papa. 
[7]To kill Don Luis! 
[8]My Papa. 21. 
[9]Dead. 
[10]Yes...my passport. 
[11]Where do I sleep? 
[12]Very tired. 24. 
[13]I do. 
[14]But it's gonna cost you. Twenty dollars. 
[15]Twenty dollars a week. 
[16]How much? 
[17]Cataleya. 
[18]Uncle Emilio? 
[19]I don't know. A long time ago. 
[20]Whose room is that? 
[21]Where is he? 32. 
[22]Killed? 
[23]By who? 
[24]I used to want to be like Lara. A super agent. 
[25]I want to be a killer. 
[26]Can you help? 
[27]Are you trying to scare me? 
[28]I've already been to school. I told you what I want to be. You don't want to help me, fine. I'll do it myself. 
[29]But I still want to be a killer. 
[30]Is that it? 
[31]Wearing no panties? 38. 
[32]Thank goodness. 
[33]Unbutton your shirt. 
[34]Now. 44. 
[35]Not room service. 
[36]I shouldn't drink. 49. 
[37]I'm so so sorry. 
[38]What's going on out there? 
[39]Really? 
[40]I probably deserve it. 
[41]I would have never forgiven myself. 50. 
[42]We're good. 
[43]Day after. 
[44]The morning after OK? 
[45]Say hello to Mama. 
[46]Hello Danny. 
[47]Why? 
[48]I have a key. 
[49]I've got nowhere to go. 
[50]Just what? 
[51]And then we have the most incredible sex. Ever. 
[52]Uh-uh. This taste good enough. 
[53]No. They put me to sleep. 
[54]Would you like the key back? 
[55]Closer? 
[56]Is this close enough? 
[57]On my end. You? 
[58]What do we have? 62. 
[59]Not long. 
[60]No reason. 
[61]I've got to get ready. 
[62]Tio. You're removed. You book the work, you collect the fees... 
[63]I come to you at nine. I say I want to be a killer. What kind of kid makes a career choice like that unless they have something on their mind. I live for the day that the blood of the son of bitch who did my parents drips in the gutter. Stop playing the innocent with me. You know this. Forever. 
[64]Why? 
[65]If you do, you would never have let me get involved in the first place. 
[66]I love you too. 
[67]Hi guys. 
[68]Hey! Hey! 
[69]OK. OK. Now sit. 65. 
[70]Now let's see what good boys you can be. 
[71]Top cut sirloin. 
[72]Nice, huh? 
[73]Red, juicy, delicious. 
[74]Stay. 
[75]Good boys. Eat. 
[76]Hola Pepe. I guess the boys gave me away. 
[77]I train them. 
[78]Of course. 
[79]And the salsa Verde. 
[80]The long one. 
[81]Of course. 
[82]As always. 
[83]Not this year. 
[84]I should do a lot of things. 
[85]Maybe next year. 
[86]Rewarding. 
[87]Your ears are better than my eyes. 
[88]Good idea. 68. 
[89]Stop right there. 
[90]Doesn't matter who I am. 
[91]I want you exactly where you are. 
[92]You know the thing about sharks. You can swim with them all day and they will just ignore you, but put one drop of blood in the water and they become your biggest admirers. 
[93]I'm not going to kill you. They are. 73. 
[94]I brought you something. 
[95]You're making fun. 
[96]Well, there's that too. 
[97]You don't want me? 
[98]What would you like to talk about? 
[99]You really want to do this? 
[100]
[101]Nothing much. 
[102]On vacation. 
[103]Down south. 
[104]There was that one. 
[105]It was OK. 
[106]Nothing much. A little swimming, fed the fish. 
[107]Now me what? 
[108]OK. Want to fuck? 
[109]Like what? 
[110]That's a hard one for me. 
[111]I'm lonely sometimes. 
[112]Isn't that enough? 
[113]I shouldn't have done this. 
[114]Any of it. 
[115]Because. 
[116]We already talked. I'm late. 
[117]I don't like eggs. 
[118]Now you know something else about me. 
[119]Don't come out. Please. Don't. 
[120]Sorry I'm late. 
[121]So what? 
[122]Tio. Could be anyone. You're seeing things that aren't there. 
[123]How many people did you kill in revenge for your boy's death? How many? And you're going to give me a lecture about revenge? 
[124]No Mama. One thing at a time. 
[125]It's me. 90. 
[126]Are you busy? 
[127]I was just sitting here, looking out the window. And I thought...where are you? 
[128]So we're seeing the same sky. 
[129]And I'm happy to hear yours. 
[130]...What picture? 
[131]What picture Danny??? 
[132]Who else saw the picture? 
[133]Who else? 92. 
[134]What does the sister of Ryan have to do with this? 
[135]Closer. I know. Goodbye Danny. 
[136]I'm sorry...I'm sorry...I'm sorry 98. 
[137]I'd like to speak to the agent in charge of the TAG killings. 
[138]This won't take long. Hands up. 
[139]Turn around. 99. 
[140]Sit. 
[141]You mean these? 
[142]Talking about covering all your bases. Your chair is pressure wired. You move your ass one inch you don't have one anymore. 
[143]I know what you're thinking. Maybe yes a bluff, maybe no. But you have to figure yes, given what you know about me. 
[144]This wasn't what I had in mind for myself when I was a kid. I wanted to be on the other side of things. Like you. 
[145]He did. 
[146]This is the last time I was happy. 100. 
[147]The next day they were dead. He killed them. 
[148]I didn't know how else to find him. 
[149]It took you a long time. 
[150]What else do I have to be? I have no one. I did. Until this morning. I had them. 
[151]And now I want to finish it. 
[152]Yes you can. He's protected by your government. 
[153]You're going to have to try harder. 101. 
[154]I found this on your table inside. Your family, right? 
[155]Brothers, sisters, nieces, nephews. Mother, father. Nice. 
[156]I know this sounds harsh. But until I get what I want, you'll go to a funeral a week. And you will begin to feel what I have felt all these years. 
[157]When your dinner's ready, the timer on it will have expired. Then you can get to work. 
[158]You guys ever been to New Orleans? 
[159]Good morning. 105. 
[160]I didn't know if you took sugar and cream, so I got one of each. 
[161]You designed the house at eight seven six Magnolia. 
[162]I would love to see the plans of this house. 
[163]Yes, it is. 
[164]It's Cataleya. 
[165]For something you can never understand. The love I had for my parents. And you killed that. 
[166]Actually Don Luis...you are exactly where I want you to be. 
[167]
[168]I know where to find you.
dialogues.MARCO:
[1]Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best. 
[2]You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back. 
[3]Hey! What are you doing? 
[4]He also said no names. 
[5]
[6]She's a kid. 
[7]What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value. 
[8]Are you stupid or what? Here. 
[9]Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job. 10. 
[10]Remember me Cataleya? 
[11]I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal. 
[12]The Cataleya orchid. His symbol. Your name. That's good. This way you will always remember him. I know this is a terrible thing for you to have seen. 
[13]Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand. Now, you know who Don Luis is? 
[14]Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you. You know he has always been good to your family, don't you? 
[15]This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that? 11. 
[16]But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like... 
[17]This. 
[18]I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right? 
[19]Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than... 
[20]This. Maybe it was in this. 
[21]Do you know what I am talking about? 
[22]Excellent. Do you know where it is? 
[23]Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want. 12. 
[24]But if you don't give it to him, he will be very unhappy. And you see what happens when he is not happy, yes? 
[25]So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him. Will you do that? 
[26]You are a smart girl. 
[27]And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat? 
[28]Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want? 
[29]
[30]Get her! 
[31]We need her alive! 
[32]Go! Go! 
[33]There! 
[34]Alive! 16. 
[35]North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets! 
[36]We got her! Close the net! 
[37]What is she doing? 
[38]No! 
[39]Get down there! 19. 
[40]
[41]Mr. Richard... 
[42]Been a long time. 
[43]Only hurts when it's humid. 
[44]The Boss likes it humid. 
[45]He's waiting for you. 
[46]It could be anyone. 
[47]Bueno? 
[48]Loud and clear. 
[49]Hello Eduardo, que pasa? 
[50]Hey sorry. Come on. 77. 
[51]Here. For you. 
[52]First for fucking up your shot. Second, for an address. You remember Fabio? The Cataleya Killer? 
[53]You went to school with his brother in law. What was his name? Emilio? 
[54]I have a problem. And we think Fabio's kid is behind it. 
[55]So you do have a memory. 
[56]
[57]Fuck... 
[58]You don't tell me what I want to know by the count of three, you scum sucking lowlife prick, your memory will be permanently disabled. One...two... 
[59]You will take up positions here... 
[60]And here. And here. You must expect the unexpected. She is like mist under a door, like a mouse in the wall. She will never attack straight on. You will not see her, until it is too late. She is that invisible. 106. 
[61]We would prefer she be taken alive. But with a bitch like this, if you get a kill shot you take it. 
[62]You four! Get the armored Mercedes! We have to get Don Luis out of here! 
[63]Don Luis! This way! Everyone to their positions! 
[64]Don Luis! You hide here. 
[65]Wait for my call. Either she is dead, or we have her far enough away so you can make it to the garage. Take the van. The armor is so thick nothing short of an atomic bomb can penetrate it. 
[66]That's the first time you ever said that. 
[67]Thank you. 
[68]Down! 
[69]Go! 109. 
[70]Now! 
[71]Outside! 
[72]Kill her! 
[73]Checking. 
[74]I think we got her. 110. 
[75]Stay where you are! 
[76]You know what bitch? I loved killing your father. He was a coward! And you know what else? I screwed your mother behind your father's back! We all did! She couldn't get enough of it! The whore! I killed her! I killed him! You want to avenge them? The whore and the coward? That's what you come from! Come out! I'm here! Come get the bullet with your name on it, Bitch! 
[77]Kill her! 111. 
[78]You two here! That door opens... 
[79]...kill anything that comes through. 
[80]Shit! 
[81]Giorgio? 
[82]Tonino? 
[83]Hold on. 112. 
[84]I will hold here! Run! Run! 
[85]Do it! Do it you bitch! Isn't this the moment you've been waiting for?
dialogues.DANNY:
[1]Do I have to? 
[2]Hello Jennifer. 
[3]You should have called. 
[4]I could have been out. 
[5]I could have been late. 
[6]It's just... 60. 
[7]You show up whenever you want to... 
[8]I know. I'm just saying... 
[9]Wouldn't you like to go to dinner sometime? 
[10]Or a movie? 
[11]So let's pop in a DVD and you can spend the night here? 
[12]No. I just want to get...I don't know... 
[13]Yes. Closer. 61. 
[14]...Yes. 
[15]Jen...? 
[16]That's real progress. Let's see. 
[17]Wow! Just what I always wanted. 
[18]No. No. I mean, a gift from you. Something to show me you're thinking of me as more than your boy toy. 79. 
[19]Wait. 
[20]Of course I do. But can't we talk a little first? 
[21]Oh, I don't know. Nothing. Anything. 
[22]Yes, I do. 
[23]So...what's new? 
[24]Where have you been? 
[25]Really? Where? 
[26]Where there are alligators? 80. 
[27]Was it nice? 
[28]What did you do? 
[29]OK. Now you. 
[30]Conversation. It goes two ways. 
[31]OK. OK. I get it. You want to protect yourself. I understand. But I'm...I don't just want to be here for the sex. I know a lot of guys would think this is perfect. She comes over, we fuck like mad. She leaves. But I need a little more. 
[32]Like...uh...some trust maybe. 
[33]I got that. I'm not in a hurry. And just so you know. The past? If it's too painful right now? 81. 
[34]If you can't talk about? That's OK. But, you know, if someone hurt you before...like a broken heart or something. I'm not responsible for that. I just want want to be here for you. To know a little about what's inside. What you feel. Just a little. 
[35]...And? 
[36]It's a good start. 
[37]Now we can have sex. 
[38]Let me this time. 
[39]Morning. 
[40]I didn't know if you like your eggs over easy or scrambled, so I made... 
[41]Wait... 
[42]Done what? 
[43]Why? 
[44]Can we talk about it? 83. 
[45]I made breakfast. 
[46]Great body, killer smile. And I think about her all day long. 
[47]You're so smart. 
[48]I knew you were the perfect guy to talk about this with. 
[49]Ryan, I'm twenty eight. I met someone who I want to be with. All the time. I have nothing. A stuffed animal. And a picture. 
[50]In my phone. 86. 
[51]It's not even a whole picture. I took it while she was asleep. 
[52]Haven't you been listening to me? I don't even know how to get in touch with her. 
[53]Maybe I shouldn't... 
[54]I just feel like, maybe, I'm invading her privacy or something. 87. 
[55]Hello? 
[56]Oh my god! I can't believe it! Hello you. 
[57]No. I...no. 
[58]In my apartment. Looking out the window. 
[59]Yes. I'm so happy to hear your voice. 
[60]You know it's so crazy. I was just sitting here, looking at your picture, thinking "I'd wish I could call her." And you called. 
[61]I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't have. But I have nothing to remember you by, except this little stuffed... 
[62]I took a picture of you while you were sleeping. With my phone. 
[63]Jen. I'm sorry. Really. I didn't mean to offend you. 
[64]...it's just you looked so cute. I can erase it if you want. It's not even a good picture...Jen? 
[65]Nobody. My friend Ryan... 
[66]His sister. I didn't want to..it's just...I wanted to contact you. I wanted to... 
[67]Shari, that's Ryan's sister...she works at Police headquarters... 
[68]I just wanted to be... 
[69]I already told you everything. She would come over, we'd have amazing sex, and she would leave. It's really late, and I'm really tired, if you're not going to arrest me... 115. 
[70]Then can I go? 
[71]Can I have a cup of coffee? 
[72]Hello? 
[73]Jen...I...uh...I'm so sorry. I didn't mean...are you OK? 
[74]FBI headquarters. I didn't tell them anything...besides... 
[75]I know. 
[76]OK...What's your real name? 
[77]Like the flower. 
[78]Will I ever see you again? 
[79]If there is ever a chance. I want you to know...I could love you. If you let me. 
[80]...I love you.
dialogues.ROSS:
[1]Where is he? 
[2]Let's go. 
[3]Same handwriting. Same flower. It's him. Let's see the location. 
[4]No comment. 
[5]You didn't lock it down? 
[6]Do it. Now. No one in or out. 
[7]I want to see paper on everyone in and out of the station in the last twenty four hours. 51. 
[8]And I want the tapes from the security cameras. 
[9]He tilted the camera just enough so the angle would catch the guard, not who was holding him. 
[10]Twenty two murders in four years all with the same M.O. The word, the flower. He's sending a message, for sure. And I'm beginning to think it's not to us. 
[11]And we're not getting anywhere with it, are we? 
[12]If the message is not for us, let's make sure the one it's intended for gets it. I want you to put it out to the press. Splash it across every newspaper, every magazine. National. I want eyeballs on it coast to coast. Monitor it. Let's see if anything comes back. 53. 
[13]Rizzo here... 
[14]The most recent, was done to keep him from talking. Alexa Milshinova... 
[15]...made a career of getting intimate with big stakes gamblers out of Vegas and then taking them off and sending them to meet their maker. D'Angelo James... 
[16]...tried to take over the heroin trade in Houston from... 
[17]The Gemini cartel. Their crimes are self explanatory, if you can read. Now I know some of you are thinking whoever is doing this makes less work for mother. And since there's no collateral damage, why are we wasting valuable manpower and resources on the case? And since until now, there has never been a clue to go on, why go on? But with this last killing... 58. 
[18]We have one. As we go to the video tape. 
[19]We can't see the assassin, but we can see... 
[20]The time. 2 AM. Which means our perp was in the station at...I don't have to spell it out for you. 
[21]These are the names, phone numbers and addresses of everyone with a pulse who entered that police station before two AM. Cops, criminals, clerks, janitors. Everyone. One of them is our target. I want each of you to locate the ten people in the folder you've been given. I want a complete dossier on every one of them for the last ten years of their lives. Run down every lead. Check out every story. Our killer is out there. And we're going to find him. Before he kills again. 
[22]OK. Let's try...organization... 
[23]Fuck... 
[24]FBI special agent Jack Ross. I'm lead agent on a case. A serial killer we call the tag killer. 
[25]Marks his victims with a flower. From Colombia. A Cataleya orchid. 74. 
[26]When I try to access information, I get stuck with a CIA Access denied folder. I understand you were the station chief down there when this rash of murders with the same MO... 
[27]Thank you. 
[28]Where are we? 
[29]A woman? Are you sure? 
[30]Let's see her booking report. 
[31]But not to get prints. 
[32]Lovely. So if there is no booking record, how did we get the name? 
[33]I don't believe this. 
[34]Well, let's see them. 
[35]That's it? 
[36]It's not a lot to go on. But put them in the data base and let's see what matches. 
[37]...a woman. 
[38]I want a trace put on an incoming transmission! 
[39]We got her! I want SWAT there! All of them! Now! 91. 
[40]She's not here. Lock the building down! 
[41]Where the hell did she go? 
[42]No one in or out! Lock this place down! Anyone? 
[43]Where? 
[44]All units! Converge on the garage. Cover every exit! 
[45]Look under every car. In every trunk!!! 
[46]Agent Ross. Hello? Hello? 
[47]Just so you know, all this? Being so smart? Covering all your bases? It's not going to matter. It's already over. The whole place is wired with web cams. 
[48]So what happened? 
[49]And all this? All these clues...they weren't for us. They were for him. 
[50]And you figured sooner or later we would make this public. 
[51]You're very patient. 
[52]You sent him a message. He sent you one back. 
[53]I can't help you. 
[54]By a part of the government I have no way of reaching. It's CIA. I don't know why. But there's no getting through it, under it, around it, believe me, I've tried. 
[55]Wait... 
[56]What about...? 
[57]Can't or won't. 
[58]Look, let's put all our cards on the table here. I've met this woman. The killer. 
[59]My apartment. She trapped me. She told me if I did not get her this man. 
[60]She will kill a member of my family every day until I have none. 
[61]Do I look like I could make something like that up? 
[62]So? What should I do now? 
[63]Ross. It's her. 103. 
[64]She says you either give her what she wants or she is going to redecorate your office. 
[65]Bright red. 
[66]She says she's using seven point six two steel jacketed armor piercing shells. And you have ten seconds to give her the address. 
[67]You can't. But I can assure you that if you don't give her the address you will be number twenty four on her hit parade. Trust me on this one. 
[68]She asked you to keep this conversation strictly confidential. 
[69]Thank you. Because honestly I didn't know how I was going to explain you splattered all over your walls. 
[70]Was there anything else? 
[71]We don't really have anything to charge you with. 
[72]Just a few more questions. 
[73]Sure. 
[74]Cataleya? Cataleya!
dialogues.EMILIO:
[1]I'm not interested in a girl right now. 29. 
[2]Cataleya? 
[3]Madonna! I thought you were dead! 
[4]I thought you were all... 
[5]You're safe now. 
[6]You're safe. 
[7]Gracias mama. 
[8]Good morning. 
[9]When was the last time you slept? 
[10]Well good. A growing body needs sleep. When I was your age I would sleep half the day. I don't know if it helped with the growing, but I was well rested for whatever came after. 
[11]My son. Your cousin. 
[12]He's dead. 
[13]Yes. 
[14]No one who is still alive. 
[15]You are very talented. Is this what you want to be? An artist? 
[16]Not anymore? 
[17]And now? 
[18]Sure. 
[19]The good news is your father bought you your life with what he gave you. The bad news is Don Luis was playing both sides, and has disappeared. You tore down everything he spent years building up with that little chip. It is something he will not forget. There is a law in this thing of ours. If someone does you, the revenge goes all the way down the line. Women, children, Grandmothers, dogs, cats. No exceptions. 
[20]I am trying to educate you. 
[21]She's still in a bit of shock. 
[22]We'll get all this stuff, then go over to this little place I know down on Maxwell street for some of these hot dogs the Polish people make here. 
[23]You like hot dogs? 
[24]Hey! 
[25]Hey! 
[26]Where you going? 
[27]Chica. Any idiot can be a killer. Look! 
[28]You want me to teach you to be a killer? No problema. I'll teach you. But you'll be dead in five years. 35. 
[29]If you want to be a killer, and survive, you have to be a smart one. You have to know things besides how to pull a trigger. You have to know how the world works. How people think. You got to learn to be psychological. That I cannot teach you, unless you learn the basics at school. Got it? 
[30]Now what's it going to be? 
[31]Cabron! 
[32]Are we good? 
[33]When are you back? 
[34]I have something. 
[35]Can't wait to see you Cara. 52. 
[36]Mama says hello back. 
[37]Safe? 
[38]Safe. 
[39]You remember the guy who was in the news for running that Ponzi scheme about a year ago? 
[40]He disappeared fifty billion dollars. The money was never recovered. Skipped out and bought himself citizenship on some shit hole of a Caribbean island that calls itself a country with no extradition laws. Lot of very pissed off people lost everything. 
[41]There's something else. 
[42]How long has this been going on? 
[43]The paper says twenty two. All like this. Tell me why. 
[44]Since you're a kid, you don't do anything for no reason. Don't play dumb, it insults me. 
[45]It's not just you in this. It's me, Mama. 63. 
[46]I watch your ass. Each and every job, I vet, I double vet. For every one I book you, I turn down five, ten. I promised to keep you safe. I KEEP YOU SAFE. Cataleya. It's a full time job, no matter what you think. Those pictures...they freaked me out. OK? I didn't realize... 
[47]Sure. Of course. But the way you're playing it. They even have a name for you. The Tag killer. I would have stopped it a long time ago. Had I known about this. 
[48]Because I love you. 
[49]You said you would stop the writing! 84. 
[50]Read this! 
[51]Seven people slaughtered in a Miami bar. I knew one of them. Years ago, in school. 
[52]I don't like it. This is getting too close. 
[53]And you are so blinded by your need for revenge that you are not seeing things that are. The handwriting is on the wall Cara. Let me read it to you. This is over. I will no longer accept jobs. I will no longer solicit jobs. You are retired. 
[54]Cara. It's time to get a life, before you run out of time. Here. 
[55]Maybe this will help you understand what I am telling you. 
[56]Everyone grows up. 
[57]I think so.
dialogues.DON LUIS:
[1]I can't believe this. 
[2]Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother. 
[3]Can you believe this guy Marco? We started when we were little...how old were we Fabio? 
[4]Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market. After all we've been through. And now we're on top, he wants to leave... 
[5]That was last year. 
[6]So you'll take a rest. 
[7]I don't even want to count. 
[8]Yeah. That's right. We're alive. And what about the future of this thing we built? 
[9]I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron? 
[10]I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard. I'm going to miss you. 
[11]OK. Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh? 
[12]To the future. 4. 
[13]So. Business is all clear? 
[14]No other copies? 
[15]Hey. 
[16]Kill this motherfucker. 
[17]Hello Mr. Richard. 
[18]I've seen it. 
[19]Coincidence. 
[20]Fabio. Fabio Maria Restrepo. But I don't understand? Why come here with this? 
[21]String? Now we are talking about string? I'm not a tailor. 
[22]And I have. 55. 
[23]And this is what you traveled all the way down here to tell me? 
[24]OK OK. What would you want? 
[25]I had nothing to do with this. I swear. 
[26]She's talking to us. 
[27]Idiot! I told you. Everyone dead. Down to the dog. 56. 
[28]You screwed up the first time. Now go fix it. Find her. Before she finds us. 
[29]Marco? 
[30]
[31]Marco. Thank you. 108. 
[32]Said what? 
[33]Don't get used to it. 
[34]Did you see the body? 
[35]Marco?? 
[36]Marco! Marco! 
[37]Marco! What the hell's going on??? 
[38]I beat you bitch! You can't kill me! I am unkillable! 
[39]Marco? 
[40]I don't understand you. You should have been dead a long time ago. You got lucky. You escaped. You were given a second chance at a life. Why did you not take it? Why did you involve yourself with this insanity? 
[41]And because of that, you have ruined your whole life to try to kill me? You stupid bitch. Don't you get it? Someone like me? 114. 
[42]I cannot be killed. I do the killing. Not the other way around. And now it is your turn to be hunted. You will never find me. But as day follows night, believe me, I will find you. And I will kill you. And you know why? Because I will never be where you can kill me. I will never be where you want me to be.
dialogues.RICHARD:
[1]Yes it has Marco. How's the hand? 
[2]Should've let us relocate you to Arizona instead of New Orleans. 
[3]There it is then. 
[4]Hello Luis. 54. 
[5]I brought you the morning paper. 
[6]And...? 
[7]Coincidence? Twenty two times? A flower that only grows in one place on earth? That used to be the calling card of...what was his name? Your former partner? The one who did your wet work? 
[8]Because when we find the end of a string we like to know where it begins. 
[9]Don Luis. Let's cut to the chase here, OK? When the Agency extracted your ass from Colombia fifteen years ago, and set you up here, we let you resume your business when what we should have done was lock you up for life. In exchange, you were supposed to keep the information flowing. 
[10]Not much, and not for a very long time. 
[11]No. What I traveled all the way down here to tell you, is there's a limit to our patience. The CIA is not an amusement park. There are no free rides. Everyone pays their way. And you, my friend, have not. 
[12]Then find out who does. 
[13]And Don Luis, don't play the innocent with us. It won't sit well with my bosses if we find out you had anything to do with this. Have a good day. 
[14]I can't believe this. 
[15]Yes? 
[16]Who is this? 
[17]I've seen the publicity. 
[18]Listen, Agent Ross, we don't give out any type of information over the phone. So what I suggest is you file a formal request with the agency for any information you might want. And I'll be more than happy to get back to you as soon as I can. 
[19]No more bullshitting me Marco. I've got the FBI on my ass now. I want that problem taken care of. Yesterday. Do you hear me? 
[20]You understand, I only agreed to this meeting out of professional courtesy. 102. 
[21]The President wanting us to reach out to you folks on the domestic side, and all that pie in the sky crap. The truth is, I really can't help you at all. 
[22]Same thing really. 
[23]Really? Where? 
[24]You're kidding me? 
[25]I'd go to the police. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting... 
[26]What does she think this is? Amateur hour? Tell her that glass is tempered to resist a direct hit by a fifty seven millimeter ordinance. 
[27]How can I be sure once she has the address she won't kill me anyway? 
[28]Eight seven six Magnolia Terrace... New Orleans. 
[29]With pleasure. 104.
dialogues.FABIO:
[1]Why not? 
[2]And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother. 
[3]Ten. 
[4]Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation? 3. 
[5]Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired. 
[6]You know how many times we should have been dead? 
[7]Neither do I. But you gotta think. How lucky we are to still be alive. 
[8]It's yours. It's not my thing any more. 
[9]I'll always be there for you Luis. Just pick up the phone, I'm there. 
[10]And I'm going to miss you. 
[11]Bueno. 
[12]All clear. 
[13]It's all here. 
[14]You even have to ask? 
[15]Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble. 
[16]This fucker! The motherfucker! 5. 
[17]This bastard thinks I'm an idiot. Playing it all mellow and shit. If he would have yelled and screamed and threatened to kill my whole family, it would have been OK. We have an hour to get out of here. At most. 
[18]We've got ten minutes. 
[19]Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This... 
[20]This is your passport. Do you understand? 6. 
[21]You find yourself alone? You go to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate. 
[22]You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember. 
[23]And this will keep you safe. 
[24]The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place. My mother, your grandmother, used to grow them. Every morning I would wake up to the sight of them. The smell of them. That's why I named you after them. It reminds us of who we are. 7. 
[25]Back! 
[26]Too late. Get ready! 
[27]I love you very much. 
[28]Alicia!
dialogues.ON CAT:
[1]She watches as the bullets split the cement all around her feet. Coming inches from ripping into them. And then the barrage stops. 
[2]She hears the pause. Looks out over the sprawl of houses that stretch up and down the steep hillsides of the favela. She looks down at her open palm at the small chip her father gave her. Pops the chip in her mouth, swallows, leaps over the small divide between her house and the next roof, and takes off running. 
[3]She drops down to another roof, this one filled with a vegetable patch, where an old man is gardening. 
[4]As she comes off the last rooftop, down into a small alley. She sprints across to a small door. She kicks at the door, which gives way and enters... 
[5]She races down a steep hill in the crowded favela streets. 
[6]She runs down a steep alley, filled with people sitting outside their homes, chatting, playing dominoes. At the end of the alley, two motorcycles appear. The riders see Cat, as she sees them. They turn their bikes into the alley... 
[7]She looks back, to the dead gunmen, disappears over the hill. 
[8]As she runs up the alley with it's open sewers running on either side. 
[9]She runs up the alley, then ducks down another one. She comes to a ladder that leads up a fence, begins to climb. 
[10]She is running for all she is worth, out of breath, scared. 
[11]She is leaning against a wall on a rooftop, gulping air, when she hears the roar of engines. Looks over the side of the building to see dozens of gunmen flooding the area. 
[12]Hearing them coming. 
[13]Seeing the grappling hooks claw onto the roof edge. 
[14]She sees Marco. She pauses for a moment, and then does something that stuns even Marco. She starts to run right towards the jeep! 
[15]She keeps sprinting toward the jeep. Another jeep appears over the hill behind her. Starts to come at her. 
[16]As she runs, her eyes go to the right, and it becomes apparent she knows exactly what she is doing. She has a plan. And she executes it. Suddenly, she leaps for the curb and... 
[17]As she wriggles her skinny little body down the grate, with barely enough room to squeeze in. But in she does squeeze. 
[18]Cat's eyes snap open. She sits up, moves with the efficiency and determination of someone who has not has a drop of alcohol. She takes a spoon from the coffee cup left for her, reaches into her mane of hair and extracts a small pin. She inserts the pin into the keyhole of the door, jiggles it. The door pops open. Cat exits the cell, takes a broom leaning in the corner, and keeping her eye on the camera above the door, she slides along the wall, until she is just under the camera. She uses the broom handle to tilt the camera up just a bit. 
[19]She holds there listening to the noise above. Hears noise below, looks down to see... 
[20]Hanging to the edge of the building. Listening, watching. 
[21]47. 
[22]85.
dialogues.MAN:
[1]Hola. We want to see Don Fabio. 
[2]You mind if we wait? 
[3]They said he's not home yet. 
[4]
[5]Change of plans. 
[6]Come with me. 
[7]She is indeed. 22. 
[8]You like music? 
[9]It's been a long day for her. Here's the check for the year's tuition. 23. 
[10]And the five hundred dollars allowance for the first six months. 
[11]Hey kid. You know what time it is? 28. 
[12]It's late, and this is not the kind of place a kid should be hanging out. What are you doing here? 
[13]Who are you? 
[14]Wait here. 
[15]Emilio. 
[16]There's a girl looking for you. 
[17]It's not that sort of thing. She's eight. 
[18]Says her name's Cataleya. 
[19]Come with me. 
[20]Hey!
dialogues.WILLIAM:
[1]
[2]Hey! I pay to see more, not less. 
[3]That's better. 
[4]I know. Anyone hungry? 
[5]Lunch is served. 
[6]Where did this come from? 
[7]Put a drop of blood in there and they'll be your biggest admirers. All the way down to your stripped clean bones. And speaking of stripped... 70. 
[8]Bedtime! 
[9]Bring extra security in for the night. 
[10]And make sure we're shut down tight. 
[11]I intend to. 
[12]Hello? 
[13]Anybody? 
[14]Who are you? 
[15]What do you want? 
[16]
[17]Whatever they paid you, I'll double it! 
[18]Please. I'll give you anything you want. Don't kill me! 
[19]Please! Please! 
[20]Please! Help! Help!
dialogues.SERGEANT:
[1]No license, no registration. No ID except a library card. Well Ms... 
[2]Valarie Phillips in addition to all that...you're being charged here with DUI, destruction of police property, driving the wrong way on a two way street... 
[3]Unless you can think of anything else you should be charged with. 
[4]That's not a crime. 
[5]Take her in the back, lock her up, put a cup of coffee in with her. Let her sleep it off, we'll book her tomorrow. 
[6]Who? 
[7]Hold on a second. 39. 
[8]Here we go. Says here you're not expected until tomorrow. 
[9]Hey Doyle! 
[10]Go take a look at the breaker on the ventilation system, will ya? 42. 
[11]Search the place! 
[12]No you shouldn't. 
[13]Tell it to the judge at your hearing in ten days. 
[14]Nothing. Fill out the forms and you can go. 
[15]Really. We need to get things organized. But don't worry, the judge will send you back, for sure. 
[16]You're lucky no one was hurt.
dialogues.MARSHAL:
[1]US Marshal Warren. We have Gennaro Rizzo here on an overnight. 
[2]Rizzo. The Mafia guy? On the way to testify up in San Francisco tomorrow? They didn't notify you? 
[3]Never expect the expected Sergeant.  Secure this place. 
[4]One man here. Two more outside the front door. Everyone else on the perimeter, in teams of two. 
[5]It's a caffeine kinda night fellas. Eyes open. 
[6]Gotta pee. 
[7]Drop it, Joe!!!!! 
[8]I didn't do it! 45. 
[9]Call a bus! 
[10]Guys! I didn't do it!!! 
[11]He's gone. 
[12]Holy shit! Call Ross. 
[13]Agent Ross? 
[14]At the hospital. 
[15]It was after the fact. I didn't think... 
[16]OK! That's it. No one in or out! Lock down!
dialogues.AGENT 1:
[1]But we're the only ones with the information. 
[2]We ID'd everyone who came in and out of the police station for the twenty four hours preceding the incident. The only one that we could not verify was a... 
[3]Valarie Phillips. Picked up for drunk driving four hours before the hit on Rizzo. 
[4]It's our only lead. 
[5]We ran the prints in the data base. No match was found. 
[6]A library card. The only ID she had was a library card. 
[7]There are the surveillance tapes. 76. 
[8]That's it. 
[9]
[10]No ma'am everything is under control. We just need you to stay inside. May we have a look around? 
[11]Nothing here. 
[12]Nothing...wait...one security camera down. 
[13]The second one is down. 
[14]The garage! 
[15]Ross. We're picking something up off that kid's phone.
dialogues.PEPE:
[1]Hola Cataleya. 66. 
[2]Anyone else? The barking would only have stopped when their screaming began. You spoil them. 
[3]If that's what you want to call it. 
[4]Did you get the beans I like? 
[5]And the salsa Verde? 
[6]Not the one in the short bottle. 
[7]I hate that other one, the chili they use sucks. Did you see your uncle? 
[8]We're going to church for Easter. 
[9]And you? 67. 
[10]As always. You should, you know. 
[11]You could start with that one. It would make us very happy. 
[12]Cataleya. No one knows what happens tomorrow, next year is a long time away. How was your trip? 
[13]Passport? 
[14]You work too much. I keep telling that to Emilio. The girl should have a life while she is still young enough to enjoy it. You should take a vacation. Go some place warm. With a nice beach. 
[15]I knew it would happen.
dialogues.VOICE:
[1]Cataleya! 
[2]Excuse me... 20. 
[3]We are making our final approach to Miami International airport. Please fasten your seat belts. 
[4]It's been our mission statement since we first opened our doors in nineteen twenty three... 
[5]Don't move. 
[6]Take off your shirt. 
[7]Now. 
[8]Turn around. 
[9]Mr. Steven Richard? 
[10]Five six. Brown eyes, hazel really, dark hair, thick, shiny...
dialogues.RYAN:
[1]Dude, you're in love. 
[2]Seriously. This comes from the heart. OK? You're nuts. The girl comes over, strips down, rocks your world, gets dressed, asks for nothing. Leaves. The only thing she doesn't do is bring the pizza and beer. You are living my dream. And you want to go and fuck it up with love? 
[3]Hey come on. It's me. Since first grade. You and me? 
[4]You have a picture? 
[5]Give it up! 
[6]Whoa...total babe-age! When do I meet the future Mrs. Delaney? 
[7]Dude. That is such a no brainer. 
[8]You're doing it for love Shari. Not for me. When they walk down the aisle, you can say you were the one made it happen. 
[9]Of course yes.
dialogues.ON MARCO:
[1]The alley is too narrow for the jeep. The men spill out, spring up the alley. 
[2]In the jeep, scouting as it rolls along. 
[3]On the phone. 
[4]18. 
[5]As his jeep speeds right for her. 
[6]Sees Cat dive to the curb. 
[7]In total disbelief, watching her disappear down the narrow slit in the curb. Both jeeps pull up. The men jump out. Marco flattens to the street, peers into the grate, sees Cat staring up at him. Marco takes his gun out. Jams it in the grate... 
[8]
dialogues.AMERICAN 1:
[1]And you say you have something for us? 
[2]May I see it? 
[3]Oh jeez... 
[4]Thank you. 
[5]We have to record this. 
[6]Where did you get this? 
[7]And where is your Papa? 
[8]Did he tell you what this is?
dialogues.MOTHER:
[1]Cat! Is your homework finished yet? 
[2]You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study. 
[3]Better to be a doctor. A lawyer. 
[4]I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father. 
[5]Fabio? 
[6]Cataleya, go pack! 
[7]I'm ready.
dialogues.CLOSE ON:
[1]
[2]A kind faced Hispanic woman, a... 
[3]One beam of sunlight slips through the narrow crack between a window and the shade covering it. 
[4]The ray of sunlight washes across Cat's sleeping face. She wakes slowly. Her eyes open after a long sleep. For a moment she does not remember where she is. 
[5]The last drop of water drips into the spoon, the spoon tips, tugging on the wire, the wire trips the switch it is connected to, the whole device comes apart, the separate pieces fall to the floor. 
[6]The front page of a newspaper with a picture of the remains of William under the headline: SHARKS EAT SHARK. The newspaper drops to reveal Richard at his desk. 
[7]
dialogues.GUNMAN:
[1]Don Luis said kill everyone. 
[2]She won't remember. 
[3]So what? 
[4]I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street. 
[5]North! 
[6]Let's go. 
[7]We lost her!
dialogues.SHERRI:
[1]I'm Sherri. And you are? 
[2]Well, 'very tired', I'm sure you want to lay down and rest your little head? 
[3]There's your bed... 
[4]A week. Peace has it's price, y'know what I'm saying? 
[5]Are we clear on that? 
[6]We got a smart one! 
[7]You can go now. In peace. 25.
dialogues.COP 1:
[1]So then I suggest, y'know, we buy some things to spice it up a bit. 
[2]A garter belt, some of those stockings that come up the thigh...it's fourteen years. Know what I mean? 
[3]Exactly. 
[4]What the... 
[5]That's all you have to say? Oops? 37. 
[6]Funny? 
[7]Wanna laugh you crazy bitch? I'll give you something to laugh about!
dialogues.ANGLE ON CAT:
[1]Sitting at the table, very still. Watching. 
[2]Cat, walking down the block as the eyes of everyone she passes follow her. She stops on a street corner. Seems lost. Opposite her a group of men, hanging outside a bar see her. The leader of the group calls her over. 
[3]Exiting the station. Ross and his team sweep past her. 
[4]Walking away from the pandemonium she is leaving behind. As it recedes over her shoulder, she picks at her fingers where the fingerprinting ink has stained them. Her prints come off! She drops the fake prints down a sewer and keeps walking. 
[5]Calmly exiting the garage, she removes a set of throwing knives from a belt around her waist, taking a long minute to gauge the distance. When he has almost reached the safety of the house... 
[6]Looking back at him. Pointing a finger at him. Before she disappears in to the drifting mists.
dialogues.ON GUNMEN:
[1]Climbing the ladder. 
[2]Surrounding a building. Throwing grappling hooks onto the roof ledge. 
[3]Cresting the roof from the ladder. 
[4]Rappelling up the side of the building on the grappling ropes. 
[5]Flooding onto the roof from both sides. Coming to the spot where Cat was only moments before. To find no Cat. One of the gunmen takes out his cell. Dials. 
[6]
dialogues.EDUARDO:
[1]I have fifty bucks on this shot. That's what's que pasa. 
[2]For what? 
[3]It's a long time. My memory... 
[4]Like I said...my memory... 
[5]Look Marco. I gotta be honest with you. Everyone knows you guys were playing a double game, and when the shit went down, you were the only ones who got out of it clean. 
[6]Yeah. For rats. Now get the fuck out, and let me take my shot.
